result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lacy Rae Storkson

defendant.name: Storkson, Lacy Rae
defendant.address: 942 S Sheldon St Apt 3, Richland Center, WI 53581

records.addlTxt:
8:54 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Lacy Rae Storkson appeared by phone.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Lacy Rae Storkson.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Richards is heard, waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record as to each count.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury status hearing on December 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:02 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Lacy Rae Storkson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Lacy Rae Storkson.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Richards is heard, ready to proceed with preliminary hearing. 

1W - Marcus Ploessl, sworn
Exam by Attorney Steiner
Cross by Attorney Richards

State requests matter to be bound over for further proceedings. 
Attorney Richards is heard. 

Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings.
Arraignment scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 08:50 am.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random PBTs and urinalysis at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.

11:24 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Lacy Rae Storkson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Lacy Rae Storkson.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Steiner requests an adjournment of Pre-lim, officer/witness is covid positive and unable to appear.
Court grants request to adjourn
Atty. Richards waives time limits for Preliminary hearing

Atty. Richards is heard on bond modification request - def. is unable to post bond as currently set. Requests court amend to signature bond.
Def. is heard on bond - has no cash available to post bond
State takes no position on bond modification request

Court modifies bond to $500.00 signature bond with same conditions: Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random PBTs and urinalysis at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:33 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Lacy Rae Storkson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video for Lacy Rae Storkson.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Richards is heard. Defendant is being held on a sanction. Will address bond modification another time.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 27, 2022 at 11:15 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on July 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Request by SPD Office to move the 7/19/22 at 2:00 PM Adjourned Initial Appearance as the attorney has a time conflict.  No objection by DA Steiner.  JA approved and moved to 7/20/22 at 9:30 AM, Zoom.

1:40 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Lacy Rae Storkson in court, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court informs defendant of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Defendant states understanding.  Right to counsel is explained. 
State is heard. No change in bond.  
Court is heard, bond will remain the same.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

10:17AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Lacy Rae Storkson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause - and will set bond

Atty. Steiner is heard on issue of bond - requests $250.00 cash, Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random PBTs and urinalysis at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Defendant is heard on bond - 

Court sets $250.00 cash bond - conditions:  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random PBTs and urinalysis at request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw.
